bill.title: Elections; Absentee Voting; Military-Overseas Voting; Validity of Ballot Cast by Voter Who Becomes Ineligible
bill.description: Provides that the ballot of an absentee or military-overseas voter is valid even if the voter becomes ineligible to vote after casting the ballot.

referrals.name: Veterans, Military, & International Affairs, & Culture and the Arts
Public Safety, Intergovernmental and Military Affairs

history.action: Pending introduction.
Introduced and Passed First Reading
Referred to VMI, JUD, referral sheet 2
Bill scheduled to be heard by VMI on Wednesday, 02-06-13 8:30AM in House conference room 312.

The committees on VMI recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 7 Ayes: Representative(s) Takai, Ito, Choy, Ohno, Onishi, Takayama, Tsuji; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 3 Excused: Representative(s) Brower, Cachola, McDermott.
Reported from VMI (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 258), recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to JUD.

Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with Representative(s) Hanohano voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Cachola, Har, C. Lee, McKelvey, Takai, Thielen excused (6).
Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Friday, 02-22-13 2:00PM in House conference room 325.
The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred until 02-26-13 at 2:00 PM.
Bill scheduled for decision making on Tuesday, 02-26-13 2:00PM in conference room 325.

The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 12 Ayes: Representative(s) Rhoads, Har, Belatti, Brower, Cabanilla, Carroll, Kawakami, C. Lee, Tsuji, Wooley, McDermott, Thielen; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Ito.
Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 751), recommending passage on Third Reading.
Passed Third Reading with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Coffman, Hanohano, Morikawa, Nakashima, Takumi excused (5). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 141).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to PSM, JDL.
The committee(s) on PSM has scheduled a public hearing on 03-19-13 2:45PM in conference room 224.

The committee(s) on PSM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in PSM were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Espero, Baker, Galuteria; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Green, Slom.
Reported from PSM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1033) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading and referral to JDL.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to JDL.
Carried over to 2014 Regular Session.
